page.title: 20NEW ABBEY - ATTITUDES
page.content: The main attitude of the people is of thankfulness that we live in such lovely surroundings. This is a lively community - large enough to support a school, a church, an excellent village shop/post office and two fine Hotels - yet small enough for us to know each other,even if only "by sight". Unemployment is virtually unknown. This is by no means a dormitory area. Many people work in the village or on the farms, though some travel daily to Dumfries by car or bus. The bus service is reasonable but the young people complain about the lack of late night buses. We are very lucky to have a surgery with two doctors in the village. We enjoy having tourists in Summer and are glad of the trade they bring, though we do grumble about the extra traffic in our quiet village street.
